column4: Hello, i have ubuntu currently installed on my laptop and i've used the gparted live cd to partition an NTFS section of my hard drive so i can dual boot with xp, however when i put in the xp disc the setup says "Unknown Disk: There is no disk in this drive"
is it the hard drive not recognized? sounds like may be the windows disk
i've tried with multiple disks..
are you getting into the install program?
i get passed the license agreement, then it's the screen that is supposed to show all of your hard drive's partitions that gives me the error message
can you mount the partition and work with it in ubuntu?
yeah i think so, however the option to unmount it is in gray, so maybe i have to use the gparted live disc instead
uh oh wait... just found somethin
there's a ! sign by it
whats the error?
and it says "Unable to read the contents of this filesystem! Because of this some operations may be unavailable."
perhaps from a livecd environment use gparted to delete and reformat the partition
ok i'll try that
thanks
make sure its primary
primary? how do i do that?
you got the choice of primary or logical when you makle it
oh okay
hey i'm back, i deleted and reparted it but it still has the ! error... i'm gonna look into that error actually, see if anyone is getting it
ok bud sorry it didnt work for y
np i'll get it, thanks for the help
